CatDescriptText: Mr. John A. Slater, 3110 Avalon Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "In your opinion, what constitutes the 'Leadership' in Negro community in Pittsburgh? What do you think of that which exists?" answer reads: "Personally, I think that it smells.  There is a lot of room for improvement.  The reason for this is that we are at the place where our leaders are selfish and satisfied with their own personal consideration more so than consideration for the race."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John A. Slater wearing sunglasses, moustache, and plaid shirt, standing on sidewalk next to parking lot and building, bridge in background
